DwdDataScrapper module

class DwdDataScrapper.DataScrapper(external_domain, external_path, local_domain='', ending=None, looking_for_ending='')[source]

Bases: object

Description

This class will download and unzip your files. Check DwdDict module first!

__init__(external_domain, external_path, local_domain='', ending=None, looking_for_ending='')[source]
Parameters

  • external_domain – as string. Will be set from your DwdDict.py

  • external_path – as string. Will be set from your DwdDict.py

  • local_domain – as string. Tells where to save your downloading and unzipping

  • ending – as list. Will be set from your DwdDict.py

  • looking_for_ending – as string. Skip this (not important for now, maybe in future)

download(download_path)[source]

Description: Is the main downloading method. It will download the data for you. It will also create folders of the same structure, that the path is in your local_domain (if not existing already). After the download it will create the needed .json file in the folder, where the data was saved. It will be called “last_download_date” and it will include some information about the filepath download-date and filename.

Parameters

download_path – as string. Can be generated by self.external_directory_indicator(). Or if you want to download something manually. The path would look like this: “climate_environment/CDC/observations_germany/climate/10_minutes/air_temperature/historical/”

Returns

“download finished” if succeeded.

download_loop()[source]

Description: Creates the download loop. Will download all the data from the self.external_directory_indicator()

Returns

None

external_directory_indicator(pre_extend_list='')[source]

Description: Will generate a list (verzeichnis_list) of oll the “href” (links and urls) on a given page

Parameters

pre_extend_list – as string. Skip this (not important for now, maybe in future)

Returns

verzeichnis_list as list

extract_zip(looking_for='.zip')[source]

Description: Extract all the files inside a path

Parameters

looking_for – as string. Should be “.zip”.

Returns

“Extracting finished” if succeeded.

generate_local_list()[source]

Description: Will generate a local_list with all filenames.

Returns

local_list as list

get_external_date()[source]

Description: Will generate a list (text_elemnts) of all text elements on a page (here the date) (will be important in future).

Returns

text_elements as list

main_update_data()[source]

Description: Compressed method for the download. Less complicated.

Returns

“Data updated” if succeeded.
